resources.string: What is your date of birth?

CyberDeck Duel (“we,” “our,” or “us”) is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy describes our data collection, usage, and security practices. We collect personal information (such as name, email, date of birth, and gender) during account creation to manage user accounts and provide gameplay functionality. In-game data, including deck composition, coins, scores, and game statistics, are collected to improve user experience and track progress. Device information, such as model and operating system, may also be collected for debugging and security. We do not sell or rent personal information to third parties. Information may be shared only with trusted service providers (e.g., Firebase) for data management or for legal reasons if required by law. Data security is paramount, and we use Firebase’s security features to protect user data; however, we advise users to keep their credentials private. Users can manage account details by logging in, and may contact us to delete their accounts if desired. CyberDeck Duel is not intended for children under 13, and we do not knowingly collect information from them. This Privacy Policy may be updated periodically, and we encourage users to review it regularly. For any questions, please contact us at support@example.com.

• Users must not engage in any activity that disrupts the gameplay experience of others, including but not limited to cheating, exploiting vulnerabilities, or using unauthorized software or tools.\n• Users are responsible for maintaining the security of their accounts. Sharing account information or passwords with others is discouraged.\n• Cybersecurity knowledge shared within the game is for educational purposes only and must not be used to harm or exploit real-world systems or individuals.

• User data is handled in compliance with privacy standards. Personal information collected (such as display names and gameplay data) is used solely to enhance game features and provide an engaging experience. \n• We do not share personal data with third parties without explicit consent, except where required by law.\n• Users can manage and delete their account data by following the steps in the app settings or contacting support.

• CyberDeck Duel encourages fair play. Users must refrain from using unauthorized tools or manipulating the game’s mechanics to gain an unfair advantage.\n• Reporting suspected cheating or abuse is encouraged. Reports will be reviewed, and actions may be taken against those who violate this policy.
• All users should interact respectfully within the game and community platforms.\n• Harassment, discrimination, or use of offensive language is prohibited and may result in a suspension or ban.

• CyberDeck Duel assets, including cards, game mechanics, and branding, are the intellectual property of the development team.\n• Unauthorized distribution, modification, or resale of game assets is prohibited.

• CyberDeck Duel is provided as is without any guarantees. Users are responsible for their own data and device security.\n• The development team is not liable for any loss or damage resulting from unauthorized access to a user’s account due to user negligence.

• Developers must adhere to ethical coding practices and consider the impact of the game on user security and privacy.\n• All team members are expected to collaborate respectfully and adhere to deadlines, development standards, and testing protocols.

• Developers must handle user data in compliance with data protection laws, ensuring encryption, secure storage, and restricted access.\n• Access to sensitive user data is restricted to authorized developers only, and usage must align with the game’s privacy policy.

• CyberDeck Duel includes simulated cybersecurity tactics for educational purposes only. Developers should ensure these elements do not unintentionally encourage or enable harmful real-world behaviors.\n• Any cybersecurity techniques or tools referenced within the game (e.g., from MITRE ATT&CK®) must be portrayed responsibly.

• Developers are responsible for maintaining the game’s security by applying regular updates and addressing vulnerabilities promptly.\n• All code changes should be peer-reviewed to ensure they align with security standards and prevent introducing new vulnerabilities.

• Features and updates must be thoroughly tested before release. This includes functionality, performance, and security testing.\n• Developers should establish protocols for error handling and reporting to improve the game continuously.

• All third-party libraries, APIs, or tools used in CyberDeck Duel must have valid licenses, and their terms should be respected.\n• Developers should ensure the game complies with applicable laws and regulations, including intellectual property, data protection, and cybersecurity standards.

• Each team member is accountable for their contributions to the project. Malicious or negligent code practices that compromise user data or gameplay integrity may result in disciplinary action.\n• A transparent logging and monitoring system should be maintained to track changes and prevent unauthorized modifications to the game.

• Developers are responsible for communicating significant updates or changes to users in a transparent manner.\n• A clear process should be available for users to report issues, request support, or provide feedback.
